markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody:
## Course Overview Welcome to Xccelerate ### Topics taught in the course During the coming weeks, we will give be covering the following languages / frameworks / topics: - HTML - CSS - Bootstrap 4 - JavaScript - jQuery - Deployment of a website - Surge - Git ## Life as a developer - New things come out everyday. **FOCUS ON FUNDAMENTALS** (algorithms, data structures, architecture design...) - However, fundamentals are kinda hard and dry compare to new things. Don't give up, it's hard for everyone. - Try to figure out things by yourself first before asking anyone (will tell you how later) ## Problem Solving (in programming) - Google - Documentation - Stackoverflow - People ## Documentation - There should be a documentation for almost every software / program / library - Best place to look for answers ## Google - There is such a wealth of information out there especially related to coding, that you will find an answer to almost any question. - Worst thing can happen to a developer is probably when you have a problem that no one googled/had before ## Google (continue) - When you Google it is always better to be as specific as you can. `javascript error callback function` doesn’t really help you as much as `javascript setTimeout error "callback" argument must be a function` ## Other resources - [W3 schools](https://www.w3schools.com/) - Scotch.io ### Course Learning Outcomes - Can explain what programming is - Can tell what programming/markup languages including HTML, CSS and JavaScript are used for - Can explain and apply basic programming concepts including variables, primitive data types, objects, iterations, functions, classes, control flow and operators, etc. ## ..Continue - Can develop a personal website with Bootstrap 4 - Can develop a interactive Canvas web app with JavaScript - Can use git to do version control ## Coding for Absolute Beginners Week 1, Lesson 1 ### What is coding/programming? `Input` ➡ `Some Program` ➡ `Output` ⬆ [the process of creating this](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_programming) ### Computer Program - A computer program is essentially a collection of **instructions** that execute **a specific task** when run by a computer. - These programs can be written by anyone, though usually programmers are responsible for their creation. ### Programming Languages

Java

JavaScript

Python

...many others, but HTML, CSS are not programming languages

### Languages you will learn

HTML (Markup Language)

CSS (Cascading Stylesheet)

JavaScript

## HTML Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser ## CSS Describes the style of HTML ### JavaScript (Although sounds similar to Java, they are completely two different languages.) a **prototype-based, multi-paradigm, dynamic** language, supporting object-oriented, imperative, and declarative (e.g. functional programming) styles.
